div.head: HOUSE OF COMMONS
div.p: The Speaker took the chair at three o‘clock.

div.head: NORTH-WEST PAPERS
div.p:
Hon. Sir John A. Macdonald presented a
reply to the address for documents referring to
the North-West, and advised the publication of
all of them, with the exception of one despatch
from Lieutenant Governor McDougall, and
such papers as would affect private interests.

div.head: STANDING ORDERS COMMITTEE
div.p:
Mr. MacFarlane presented the first report of
the Committee on Standing Orders, and asked
that the quorum should be reduced to nine
Carried.

div.head:
PRINTING COMMITTEE—PUBLIC
ACCOUNTS
div.p:
Mr. Mackenzie moved that the Committee
on Printing be instructed to inquire into the
cause of the delay in printing the public
accounts. He did this in order to facilitate
business.

Hon. Mr. Holton seconded the motion.
Carried.

div.head:
NOVA SCOTIA FINANCIAL
ARRANGEMENTS
div.p:
Hon. Sir John A. Macdonald laid upon the
table correspondence with reference to the
financial arrangements with Nova Scotia.

div.head: REVENUE RETURNS
div.p:
The following were laid on the table: State
ments of spirits, malt liquor, malt, tobacco,
cigars, etc., snuff, petroleum and manufactures
in bond, the materials used, the manufactures
therefrom, the revenue derived therefrom; also
the revenue from bill stamps, in the Dominion
of Canada for the fiscal year ending 30th June,
1869.
